subject: MANTA-3959 muskie should spread GET load to sharks evenly
commitMessage: MANTA-3959 muskie should spread GET load to sharks evenly

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1:

New commits:
    
    commit fd801e0ab4bb1e5a7d77974aef7e914868562d8d
    
    MANTA-3959 read from a random shark
    To more evenly spread read load, shuffle the set of sharks to read from. During
    the work I noticed there were two implementations of shuffle in the code, one in
    picker.js, and one in utils.js. I couldn't find a call to the utils.js shuffle
    in the code. The shuffle in picker.js has been proven in production. I moved it
    to utils so that write and read share a common shuffle impl.
    NOTE: TODO: there were 6 failing tests BEFORE and AFTER the change (same 6) that
    I still need to investigate.

Patch Set 1: CI-Testing+1

"make check" passed ok
Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.

Patch Set 2:

New commits:
    
    commit b0c96b5d9487c74c48757bfe23617a918a394088
    
    MANTA-3959 read from a random shark
    To more evenly spread read load, shuffle the set of sharks to read from. During
    the work I noticed there were two implementations of shuffle in the code, one in
    picker.js, and one in utils.js. I couldn't find a call to the utils.js shuffle
    in the code. The shuffle in picker.js has been proven in production. I moved it
    to utils so that write and read share a common shuffle impl.
    NOTE: TODO: there were 6 failing tests BEFORE and AFTER the change (same 6) that
    I still need to investigate.

Patch Set 2:

"make check" passed ok

Patch Set 2:

Thanks for doing this change!

For IA, I have a couple more things I think we would want to test:
- Does the Muskie test suite run successfully?
- One behavior that I think is important to regression test is that Muskie continues to contact all sharks it has for an object if one (or more) of those sharks are not reachable. The way I would do this is to simulate taking one of the sharks down and trying several GETs for the test object, as you did in the test in the ticket. I would try this for both sharks assigned to the test object. There are a couple ways you can simulate this, but I've done this before by cutting off traffic using ipdadm(1M) (see MANTA-2737 for an example).
Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased

Patch Set 3:

"make check" passed ok

 > Muskie continues to contact all sharks it has for an object if one
 > (or more) of those sharks are not reachable. The way I would do
 > this is to simulate taking one of the sharks down and trying

Will do today, thanks!

 > > (or more) of those sharks are not reachable. The way I would do
 > > this is to simulate taking one of the sharks down and trying

 > > object. There are a couple ways you can simulate this, but I've
 > > done this before by cutting off traffic using ipdadm(1M) (see
 > > MANTA-2737 for an example).
 > 
 > Will do today, thanks!

Ok. I 100 trials as normal, then 100 where I drop 100% packets to one of the sharks. All requests complete, but where 100% packets are dropped some requests take ~7seconds vs 3 seconds for most where no packets are dropped. I did make a histo, not sure how to add it here (https://www.dropbox.com/s/f5mtc667s70wjw9/mgets.png?dl=0) It's interesting how the long requests drop off.

I did think that another test would just be that shuffle has the property that the same elements are in the shuffled array as are in the initial array.
Uploaded patch set 4.

Patch Set 4: CI-Testing+1

"make check" passed ok
Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased

Patch Set 5:

"make check" passed ok
Uploaded patch set 6.

Patch Set 6: CI-Testing+1

"make check" passed ok

Patch Set 6:

> Ok. I 100 trials as normal, then 100 where I drop 100% packets to one of the sharks. All requests complete, but where 100% packets are dropped some requests take ~7seconds vs 3 seconds for most where no packets are dropped. I did make a histo, not sure how to add it here (https://www.dropbox.com/s/f5mtc667s70wjw9/mgets.png?dl=0) It's interesting how the long requests drop off.

Thanks for doing this! Could you add these new testing notes to the ticket comments (including a note that you the test suite successfully)? One thing I forgot to mention before is to make sure the change is `make check` clean in addition to the test suite. Another option would be to run `make prepush`, which runs `make check` and the test suite again. Since you already ran the test suite, `make check` is sufficient.

I think the 7 second requests make sense given that the timeout for a shark reply is 2 seconds (https://github.com/joyent/manta-muskie/blob/3b57299bb0edf3ce6e101530cf189df9de34d154/lib/shark_client.js#L207) and muskie will retry 3 times. So when muskie tries the shark that is down first, we would expect at least 6 seconds of latency from those retries. I'm not sure where 3 seconds comes in. Perhaps those are requests where the shark that is receiving traffic is first?

Once you add the testing notes to the ticket, I will add IA approval :)
